newsitem.title: NEW ZEALAND: Ericsson seen in NZ Telecom deal.
newsitem.headline: Ericsson seen in NZ Telecom deal.

text.p: Telecom New Zealand Limited is due to buy digital mobile telephone equipment from Swedish supplier LM Ericsson worth $250 to $350 million, the New Zealand Press Association news agency reported on Monday night.
It was not initially possible to confirm the deal through Telecom on Tuesday but the NZPA reported the contract was to supply network switches and base stations over five years.
"Telecom will also buy Cellular Digital Packet Data (CDPD) equipment and wireless-intelligent network capacity," the report added.
CDPD, being trialled by Telecom, will enable such applications as mobile Eftpos (electronic payment), vehicle tracking, wireless internet access and remote access to corporate databases.
